Subject: Misconfigured Redirects
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=582247024
From: Colin Rosenthal <csr@...>

Hi,

I can't see if Heritrix has addressed the following scenario in any 
recent fixes (is Heritrix issue tracking now only on github?):

Suppose we have a domain
d1.dk
that redirects to
d2.dk

but it is misconfigured so that
d1.dk/foobar
redirects to
d2.dkfoobar

We see this _a lot_!

It becomes a problem because heritrix goes looking for
d2.dkfavicon.ico and d2.dkrobots.txt
and then makes dns lookups for
dkfavicon.ico and dkrobots.txt

These fail, and pollute the crawl-log with a load of obvious nonsense. I 
guess the better behaviour is for Heritrix to insert a "/" before 
favicon.ico and robots.txt if
it is missing. Does anyone else see this problem much and/or have a 
better solution?

cheers,
Colin


-- 
Colin Rosenthal PhD
Senior IT Consultant
Royal Danish Library (Aarhus)
